content.description: Ethylene causes fruits to ripen. In a signaling pathway, receptors activate transcription factors, which ultimately leads to ripening.
content.question: Which of the following best supports the claim that ethylene initiates the signal transduction pathway that leads to ripening of fruit?

choices.label: Ethylene is a simple gaseous molecule, which makes it easily detected by receptors.
Fruit will ripen in closed containers without exposure to air.
Ethylene synthesis is under both positive and negative feedback regulation.
Loss-of-function mutations in ethylene receptors result in changes to the ripening process.

content.answer: Loss-of-function mutations in ethylene receptors result in changes to the ripening process.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
